cost.source: Calculated as a sales-weighted average of the eight most common frame material and operator type combinations in residential windows based on Exhibit D.6 in the 'Study of the U.S. Market for Windows, Doors and Skylights' published by IGMA, FGIA, and DuckerFrontier in May 2020. These combinations represent 80% of total window sales by unit count. The sales shares for the eight most common window frame material and operator type combinations were normalized and then applied to the Total O&P values (costs including overhead and profit margin) in the RSMeans 2022 Building Construction Data, Residential New Construction, National Average (Location), entry codes: 085313300128, 085313200230, 085313200170, 085313400240, 085213300140, 085313500130, 085213200120, 085113203100. One configuration, vinyl slider windows, did not have a dedicated cost value; for this window configuration, single-hung cost was used instead.

lifetime.source: National Association of Homebuilders, Study of the Life Expectancy of Home Components, 2007, p. 15, assuming wood as the norm

cost.source: Calculated as a sales-weighted average of the four most common frame material and window category (i.e., storefront, punched opening, or curtain wall) combinations in commercial buildings based on Exhibit D-29 in the 'Study of the U.S. Market for Windows, Doors and Skylights' published by IGMA, FGIA, and DuckerFrontier in May 2020. These combinations were extracted after lumping sales volumes from aluminum frame windows with and without a thermal break (where sales are dominated by windows with a thermal break). These combinations represent 96% of commercial window sales by total vision area. The sales shares were normalized and then applied to the Total O&P values (costs including overhead and profit margin) in the RSMeans 2022 Building Construction Data, Commercial New Construction, National Average (Location), Open Shop, entry codes: 085113204100, 084313200600, 084413100150, 085313200260.

lifetime.source: National Association of Homebuilders, Study of the Life Expectancy of Home Components, 2007, p. 15, assuming midpoint of aluminum and wood
National Association of Homebuilders, Study of the Life Expectancy of Home Components, 2007, p. 15
National Association of Homebuilders, Study of the Life Expectancy of Home Components, 2007, p. 15

cost.source: RSMeans 2022 Building Construction Data, Residential New Construction, National Average (Location), rigid insulation, for walls, isocyanurate, 4' x 8' sheet, foil faced, both sides, 1 in. thick (#072113101640), total O&P; doubled to represent 2 in. exterior continuous insulation

lifetime.source: National Association of Homebuilders, Study of the Life Expectancy of Home Components, 2007, p. 15

cost.source: RSMeans 2022 Building Construction Data, Commercial New Construction, National Average (Location), blanket insulation for walls, kraft faced fiberglass, R15, 15 in. wide (#07211620xxxx)

lifetime.source: National Association of Homebuilders, Study of the Life Expectancy of Home Components, 2007, p. 15

cost.source: RSMeans 2022 Building Construction Data, Residential New Construction, National Average (Location), extruded polystyrene (XPS), 25 psi compressive strength, 3 in. thick, R15 (#072113101960).

lifetime.source: National Association of Homebuilders, Study of the Life Expectancy of Home Components, 2007, p. 11

cost.source: RSMeans 2022 Building Construction Data, Commercial New Construction, National Average (Location), extruded polystyrene (XPS), 25 psi compressive strength, 3 in. thick, R15 (#072113101960)

lifetime.source: National Association of Homebuilders, Study of the Life Expectancy of Home Components, 2007, p. 11

cost.source: RSMeans 2022 Building Construction Data, Residential New Construction, National Average (Location), blown insulation ceilings, with open access, fiberglass, 20 in. thick, R49 (#072126101500) adjusted to R60 (24 in. thick) assuming a constant total O&P cost per inch at high insulation levels

lifetime.source: National Association of Homebuilders, Study of the Life Expectancy of Home Components, 2007, p. 13, midpoint of asphalt and wood

source.new: RSMeans 2022 Building Construction Data, Commercial New Construction, National Average (Location), 4 in. thick isocyanurate insulation 4'x8' boards, foil faced both sides (#072113101680)
source.existing: RSMeans 2022 Building Construction Data, National Average (Location), Estimated with 4 in. thick isocyanurate insulation 4'x8' boards, foil faced both sides and a 45% labor cost reduction compared to new construction as suggested by a comparison between new construction and retrofit labor productivity and labor time (#072113101680)

lifetime.source: Typical least cost commercial roof service life reported in Coffelt et al., Life-Cycle Costs of Commercial Roof Systems, 2010
